bill_title: to provide a provision allowing any regional railroad authority to opt out of the taxing authority provided pursuant to chapter 49-17A.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a provision allowing any regional railroad authority to opt out of the taxing authority provided pursuant to chapter 49-17A. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 49-17A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any railroad authority may adopt a resolution amending the provisions of the agreement authorized by § 49-17A-2 specifying that the railroad authority may not levy a tax pursuant to the provisions provided in chapter 49-17A. The railroad authority shall forward a certified copy of the resolution to the secretary of state and secretary of state shall issue an amended certificate of incorporation. The railroad authority may not adopt a resolution to amend or repeal this resolution prohibiting the railroad authority from levying a tax pursuant to the provisions provided in chapter 49-17A. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide a provision allowing any regional railroad authority to opt out of the taxing authority provided pursuant to chapter 49-17A. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 49-17A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Any railroad authority may adopt a resolution amending the provisions of the agreement authorized by § 49-17A-2 to specify that the railroad authority may not levy a tax pursuant to the provisions provided in chapter 49-17A. The railroad authority shall file a certified copy of the resolution with the secretary of state and the secretary of state shall issue an amended certificate of incorporation. The railroad authority may not adopt a resolution to amend or repeal this resolution prohibiting the railroad authority from levying a tax pursuant to the provisions provided in chapter 49-17A. BILL HISTORY January 29 - First read in House and referred to Taxation. H.J. 198 February 4 - Scheduled for hearing. February 4 - Passed as amended, AYES 13, NAYS 0. H.J. 287
